meanings.definition: To make greater in power, influence, or reputation.
meanings.sent1: She was aggrandising her role in the school play by volunteering to help with the props.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's efforts to aggrandise his authority were met with skepticism by the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was aggrandising its collection of acorns, proudly showing them off to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The artist aggrandised the simple landscape by adding vibrant colors and intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks were aggrandising his reputation as the best entertainer in town.

meanings.definition: To enhance the power, wealth, position, or reputation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The company's new marketing campaign aimed to aggrandise its brand in the eyes of consumers.
meanings.sent2: The king sought to aggrandise his kingdom by conquering neighboring lands.
meanings.sent3: The chef was aggrandising the flavor of the dish by adding a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's dedication to training was aggrandising his performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: The charity event was aggrandising the community's spirit of giving.
